page.title: 08FARMING - 2
page.content: Hillside Farm, Oddington, is a fruit and vegetable farm with some cereals in rotation. There is a farm shop and 'Pick Your Own' trade in soft fruit. Polythene tunnels are used for tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers and beans. Small tunnels are used over early crops of strawberries, a very profitable fruit. The crops can be irrigated from a stream. A busy main road runs through the farm and the danger of moving cattle across it is the reason the fruit farm was begun 30 years ago. The road brings a good number of customers. A total of 44 hectares are farmed.
